totalisations.description: Totals that relate to the charge.

totalOverdue.description: The charge amount that is overdue (collectable now). The value must be between -99999999999.99 and 99999999999.99 to 2 decimal places.

totalNotYetDue.description: The charge amount that has been posted to the account, but is not yet payable. The due date is in the future. The value must be between -99999999999.99 and 99999999999.99 to 2 decimal places.

totalBalance.description: The net charge amount (the amount that is overdue, minus any credit that is in the account). The value must be between -99999999999.99 and 99999999999.99 to 2 decimal places.

totalCredit.description: Credit that is in the individual's or organisation's account, which has not yet been allocated to any charges. The value must be between -99999999999.99 and 99999999999.99 to 2 decimal places.

totalCleared.description: The amount that the individual or organisation has paid towards the charge already. The value must be between -99999999999.99 and 99999999999.99 to 2 decimal places.

documentDetails.description: All the documents that refer to the charge. An individual document will only contain one charge reference, but that charge reference could appear in multiple documents. For example, this might be the case if a charge has been levied and subsequently reversed, or if multiple periodic interest charges share the same charge reference.

postingDate.description: The date that the charge was posted to the individual's or organisation's account.

issueDate.description: The date that correspondence about the charge was sent to the individual or organisation.

documentTotalAmount.description: The total sum of the line items within the document. The value must be between -99999999999.99 and 99999999999.99 to 2 decimal places.

documentClearedAmount.description: The amount that has been paid, reversed, removed or cleared. For example, this could be the portion of a charge that has already been paid. The value must be between -99999999999.99 and 99999999999.99 to 2 decimal places.

documentOutstandingAmount.description: The remaining balance. The value must be between -99999999999.99 and 99999999999.99 to 2 decimal places.

documentInterestTotal.description: The total amount of interest that is associated with the document. The value must be between -99999999999.99 and 99999999999.99 to 2 decimal places.

lineItemDetails.description: The line items that make up the document. A document can contain more than one line item. For example, an individual or organisation might submit an amendment form that contains multiple corrections (perhaps the individual or organisation paid too much VAT for one tax period, but not enough for the next). Each correction will comprise an individual line item. HMRC will take all of the line items into account when it calculates the charge.

periodFromDate.description: The start date of this period.

periodToDate.description: The end date of this period.

periodKey.description: A four-digit reference containing characters and numbers that identify a specific period of the due date.

netDueDate.description: Net due date relates to multiple line items.

amount.description: The value must be between -99999999999.99 and 99999999999.99 to 2 decimal places.

interestKey.description: A specific line item that has been locked, rather than the entirety of the document. A two-digit reference to identify the interest key.

interestStartDate.description: The date that the interest charges started.
